channel.title: In Need of Assistance When Someone Finds the Time!
channel.description:
[center][b]"The server ________________ is offline, it must be online before you can register it here."
I know my ports are forwarded correctly. Jdk path is correct. The client has been JAR'ed and everything, but yet, it still says it's offline.
My IP has been put in as 127.0.0.1 on the client. Is that correct?
I'm really confused. If somebody knows a solution to my issue, it would be greatly appreciated!
I worked on this all night and finally thought I got the hang of it. It's the first time I've ever tried bring a RSPS to life. Everything was going so smoothly.
I'm very confused.
But, anyway, yes. When someone finds the time and is able to help me, I would really appreciate it.
Thank you very much for your time![/b][/center]

item.title: In Need of Assistance When Someone Finds the Time!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That formatting…

What you set your client’s ip to has nothing to do with registering a server to a toplist website. You must double check that you put the correct ip in the registration field, and make sure you allow inbound connections to port 43594.

Read full topic
item.source: In Need of Assistance When Someone Finds the Time!

Read full topic

item.title: In Need of Assistance When Someone Finds the Time!
item.dc:creator: @PloxScape PloxScape
item.description:
@PloxScape wrote:

[center][b]“The server ________________ is offline, it must be online before you can register it here.”

I know my ports are forwarded correctly. Jdk path is correct. The client has been JAR’ed and everything, but yet, it still says it’s offline.

My IP has been put in as 127.0.0.1 on the client. Is that correct?

I’m really confused. If somebody knows a solution to my issue, it would be greatly appreciated!

I worked on this all night and finally thought I got the hang of it. It’s the first time I’ve ever tried bring a RSPS to life. Everything was going so smoothly.

I’m very confused.

But, anyway, yes. When someone finds the time and is able to help me, I would really appreciate it.

Thank you very much for your time![/b][/center]
